discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Its B, Splunk Fundementals 3 page 58 says: 
typeof: returns a string that represents
the data type of X
â€“ Possible results: number, string, or bool

Ans is C
C. Number, String, Null

The answer is C. 
C. Number, String, Null

Its B. 
The following example takes one argument and returns a string representation of its type. This example returns "NumberStringBoolInvalid"

questions.question_text: Which of the following are potential string results returned by the typeof function?
If a search contains a subsearch, what is the order of execution?

discussion.content: inner search (subsearch) executed first and passes the results to the outer (basic or primary search)

choices.D: The two searches are executed in parallel.
choices.A: The order of execution depends on whether either search uses a stats command.

questions.question_text: How is a multivalue field created from product="a,b,c,d"?

discussion.content:
yep, D is correct.
mvexpand creates a different event for each value in a mv field.

Selected Answer: D
Correct answer is D. makemv [delim=<string> | tokenizer=<string>] [allowempty=<bool>] [setsv=<bool>] <field> . See https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/SplunkCloud/latest/SearchReference/Makemv

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/SplunkCloud/9.3.2408/Viz/ChartEventAnnotations
_time is an mandatory but the annotation category and annotation label is optional
B. _time is the only field that is required.

Selected Answer: B
Correct answer is B. Only _time is a required field. See https://docs.splunk.com/Documentation/SplunkCloud/latest/Viz/ChartEventAnnotations

questions.question_text: Which field is required for an event annotation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

sum -> sum of values of a specified field
count -> count of values of specified field (or all events)
list -> list all values of a specified field (even if its repeated)
values -> list unique values of a specified field

questions.question_text: Which stats function is used to return a sorted list of unique field values?
